evaluate.subTitle: Evaluation
evaluate.title: Spin up CDAP in the Cloud for Evaluation
evaluate.description: The CDAP Cloud Sandbox is a single-process package of CDAP optimized for the Cloud. Functionally identical with the CDAP Local Sandbox, it may differ in nomenclature, and may have additional optimizations - such as dedicated tabs in the Hub - specific to individual cloud providers. The CDAP Cloud Sandbox is available from the respective cloud providers`  Marketplaces.

items.title: Google Cloud Platform
items.description: Spin up the CDAP Cloud Sandbox on the Google Cloud Marketplace.

items.title: Amazon Web Service
items.description: Spin up a single-process instance of CDAP on AWS Marketplace.

items.title: Microsoft Azure
items.description: Spin up a single-process instance of CDAP on Azure Marketplace.

on_production.subTitle: Production
on_production.title: Install CDAP in Mission-Critical Environments
on_production.description: If you are ready to install CDAP in mission critical Cloud environments, choose one of the options below

items.title:
Google Cloud Data Fusion
(powered by CDAP)
items.description: Fully-managed, cloud-native, enterprise data integration service for quickly building and managing data pipelines

items.title: CDAP for Amazon EMR
items.description: Installation scripts hosted on Github for running and managing CDAP on an Amazon EMR cluster.

items.title: CDAP for Azure HDInsight
items.description: Package containing installation scripts for running and managing CDAP on an Azure HDInsight cluster.

evaluate.subTitle: Evaluation
evaluate.title: Run CDAP Locally for Evaluation
evaluate.description: CDAP is available as a standalone package to install and run locally, including everything to get you started immediately on experimenting with data applications on your laptop or desktop. Once you are ready, your local copy can be easily moved to a distributed environment. These packages are not meant for production use and no patching is available for those images once deployed.

overlay_items.title: CDAP 5.1.2 for Linux/Mac
overlay_items.description: CDAP for Linux/MacOSX provides a complete environment for installing and running CDAP on your Linux or MacOSX desktop or laptop.

overlay_right.title: CDAP 5.1.2 for Linux/Mac
overlay_right.description_body: CDAP Docker provides a clean, contained environment for trying out CDAP on your desktop or laptop.
requirements_list: Supported OS: MacOS, RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOs
Other requirements: JDK 8, Node.js versions 8.7.0+, Apache Maven 3.0+

overlay_right.title: CDAP 4.3.5 for Linux/Mac
overlay_right.description_body: CDAP Docker provides a clean, contained environment for trying out CDAP on your desktop or laptop.
requirements_list: Supported OS: MacOS, RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOs
Other requirements: JDK 8, Node.js versions 8.7.0+, Apache Maven 3.0+

overlay_items.description: CDAP for Linux/MacOSX provides a complete environment for installing and running CDAP on your Linux or MacOSX desktop or laptop.

Other requirements: JDK 8, Node.js versions 8.7.0+, Apache Maven 3.0+

items.title: Linux/Mac OSX
items.description: Download a standalone zip file for trying out CDAP on your Linux or Mac OSX machine.

items.title: VM
items.description: Download a pre-built virtual machine for trying out CDAP on your Linux, Mac OSX or Windows machines.

items.title: Docker
items.description: Download a clean, pre-built Docker image for trying out CDAP on your Linux, MacOSX or Windows machines.

on_production.subTitle: Production
on_production.title: Get connected
on_production.description: If you are ready to install CDAP on your Kubernetes or Apache Hadoop clusters, in critical environments, choose from one of the following options:

overlay_items.title: CDAP 5.1.2 for Linux/Mac
overlay_items.description: CDAP for Linux/MacOSX provides a complete environment for installing and running CDAP on your Linux or MacOSX desktop or laptop.

overlay_right.title: CDAP 5.1.2 for CDH
overlay_right.description_body: Use the CDAP Custom Service Descriptor (CSD) to install and manage CDAP on CM managed Hadoop clusters.
requirements_list: Supported OS: RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOS, OEL, Debian

overlay_right.title: CDAP 4.3.5 for Linux/Mac
overlay_right.description_body: Use the CDAP Custom Service Descriptor (CSD) to install and manage CDAP on CM managed Hadoop clusters.
requirements_list: Supported OS: RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOS, OEL, Debian

overlay_items.title: CDAP 5.1.2 for Ambari
overlay_items.description: Use Apache Ambari to add CDAP to an existing HDP cluster (which already has the required services installed).

overlay_right.title: CDAP 5.1.2 Ambari
overlay_right.description_body: CDAP VM provides a complete, pre-built environment for running CDAP on your desktop or laptop.
requirements_list: Supported OS: RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOS, OEL, Debian

overlay_right.title: CDAP 4.3.5 Ambari
overlay_right.description_body: CDAP VM provides a complete, pre-built environment for running CDAP on your desktop or laptop.
requirements_list: Supported OS: RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOS, OEL, Debian

overlay_items.title: CDAP 5.1.2 RPM/DEB
overlay_items.description: CDAP for Linux/MacOSX provides a complete environment for installing and running CDAP on your Linux or MacOSX desktop or laptop.

overlay_right.title: CDAP 5.1.2 for RPM/DEB
overlay_right.description_body: RPM and Debian distributions of CDAP to support your MapR and other installation needs.
requirements_list: Supported OS: MacOS, RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOs
Supported Hadoop versions: MapR, Apache BigTop, Apache Hadoop

overlay_right.title: CDAP 4.3.5 for RPM/DEB
overlay_right.description_body: RPM and Debian distributions of CDAP to support your MapR and other installation needs.
requirements_list: Supported OS: MacOS, RedHat Linux, Ubuntu, CentOs
Supported Hadoop versions: MapR, Apache BigTop, Apache Hadoop

items.title: CDAP for CDH
items.description: To add CDAP to your Cloudera Manager installations, use the CDAP Custom Service Descriptor (CSD).

items.title: CDAP for Ambari
items.description: To use CDAP within your Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) environment, use Apache Ambari.

items.title: CDAP for MapR, BigTop and more
items.description: If you are using MapR, BigTop or the Apache Hadoop, use RPM and Debian distributions of CDAP.

items.title: User guide
items.description: Hands on guides for developers, business analysts and data scientists to get started with CDAP

items.title: Tutorial & samples
items.description: Step-by-step instructions for solving common use-cases using CDAP

items.title: Documentation
items.description: Detailed technical documentation for using, extending and administering CDAP
